Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: The student can draw a basic outline of a fish, though it may lack detail or accuracy.
The student may attempt to draw water as part of the habitat but might not label it correctly.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to correctly label the fish or identify its parts (e.g., *(student doesnâ€™t know fins from tail)*).
The student may not identify or label the specific type of water body, like a lake or ocean (e.g., *(student just draws blue waves)*).
The student likely cannot show or label other components of the fish's environment such as plants or rocks (e.g., *(omits environmental details)*).
The student is unable to illustrate or explain how the fish interacts with its environment to survive (e.g., *(student thinks fish just 'floats' in water)*).
The student does not demonstrate any understanding of how different parts of the habitat work together (e.g., *(may think fish live in trees)*).
